lead_paragraph: The father of a high school softball player in Meriden, Conn., was sentenced to five years’ probation yesterday for beating his daughter’s coach with a bat during a practice last year. Mark Picard, 48, of North Branford, also received a five-year suspended sentence. He was arrested May 17, 2005, after beating John Crovo, the coach at Sacred Heart Academy in Hamden. Authorities said Picard was upset that Crovo had suspended his daughter Melanie, a senior co-captain at the time, after she missed a game to attend her boyfriend’s prom.
